Name: Social Events Interface (Social2Orion **)

Documentation.Description:
Basic Concepts

Social2Orion is a REST based client that exposes a @POST method via which an external provider will be able to send the marketplace data on social events (such as concerts, football matches, etc) that can affect consumption/production in the Trial site area.

Basic Design Principles

The following picture gives a snapshot of the java classes (and the interaction among these) that have been developed for Social2Orion:


Figure 1: Social2Orion domain model

DSE Interwork


Figure 2: Energy marketplace architecture (focused on Social2Orion DSE)

The left part of the picture puts emphasis on the data sources and the related providers; the system will accept different types of data as inputs.

The input "raw" data will “feed” an instance of ORION Context Broker thus acting as a sort of “publisher” in “a Publish/Subscribe” pattern:
  • Metering data coming from the smart-meters which have been installed at the trial Site located in Terni, Italy (both instant and cumulative meter readings);
  • Weather forecast data of the interested trial site area retrieved from an external service ( http://developer.forecast.io);
  • Social events data (like concerts, football matches, etc) affecting consumption and production in the trial site area which are going to be loaded by an "external" provider through a REST interface .
  • Cost of energy, cost of energy produced by DERs and the cost of system transmission power plants which are going to be loaded by an energy retailer through a REST interface.

The above mentioned data are loaded onto ORION Context Broker through its REST APIs and then mapped to events (“entities” of a MongoDB underlying ORION). These context events (ORION “entities”) are updated with a certain frequency thus representing data flowing into the energy marketplace from the outside “real world”.

GE Dependancies

The implementation of this DSE is working with an instance of ORION v0.14.

Usage:
Installation guide

IMPORTANT: we kindly remind you that this software module is strictly tight to the use of ORION Context Broker GE thus meaning that you should have previously set up an ORION instance of yours. Please have a look at ORION GE documentation at the following link publishsubscribe-context-broker-orion-context-broker

Download the artefact (in the form a .war file) from the download section.
Open the .war file (you can use an appropriate software like “winRar”), open the “social2orion.properties” file located in the following directory: WEB-INF/classes/ and then amend the following configuration properties: 

social2orion.orionServerUrl = http://(your ORION instance URL):1026
social2orion.registerContexPath = NGSI10/updateContext

Save the changes to the .properties file and deploy the .war file on a Tomcat application server using the “Tomcat Web Application Manager” (see attached screenshot). We recommend you to use an updated version of Tomcat; we have used Apache Tomcat 7.xx.


Figure 3: How to the deploy the social2orion .war file

To verify that the deploy of the social2orion application was done successfully and that it consequently runs, you have to type the following URL in a common browser like Google Chrome or Microsoft Internet Explorer: 

http://(your tomcat ip)/social2orion/rest/sendSocialData

and you should get a page like the following (see attached screenshot).


Figure 4: Test "sendSocialData" GET method in a browser

If the previous page appears, the social2orion application is correctly deployed.

Usage guide

Now, in order to send a “Social Event” to ORION, use a REST client such as DHC - REST/HTTP API Client chrome extension (see attached screenshot):


Figure 5: Send a "Social Event" to ORION

Please fill in with the following parametres:
SERVICE (POST) 

http://(your tomcat ip)/social2orion/rest/sendSocialData

HEADERS 

Content-Type: application/xml

BODY 

<social socialEventTypology=" _(social event name)_ " 
socialEventDateTime=" _(social event date and time: dd-mm-yyyy-hh:MM:ss)_ " 
socialEventImportancy=" _(level of severity with respect to how the event is going to affect consumption/production in a specific area)_ " 
socialEventVenueName=" _(name of the venue where the social event is going to take place)_ " 
socialEventVenueAddress=" _(address of the venue)_ " 
socialEventLocationCoordLong=" _(longitude coordinate of the venue)_ " 
socialEventLocationCoordLat=" _(latitude coordinate of the venue)_ "/>

and finally click the SEND button.

If you get 200 OK in the HTTP Response, you should have submitted a “social event” to ORION.

Address/Protocol

The address of the REST call invoking the Social2Orion service depends on the IP address/port of the application server where the module is going to be deployed. 

EXAMPLE: http://(your tomcat ip)/social2orion/rest/sendSocialData

Protocol: HTTP

Commands

The following HTTP commands can be used to manipulate the data controlled by the DSE:
  • HTTP GET command used to test if the module has been properly installed; a simple XML, such the one shown below, is expected as output:

<socialsocialID="22222" socialEventLocationCoordLat="38.8888" socialEventLocationCoordLong="38.8888" socialEventVenueAddress="Via delle Magnolie" socialEventVenueName="Palazzetto dello Sport" socialEventImportancy="2" socialEventDateTime="27-07-2014-20:30:00" socialEventTypology="Basketball match" currentTime="0"/>

  • HTTP POST to send new information to the module.

Endpoints

The base URI to invoke the rest method exposed by Social2Orion is: 

http://(your tomcat ip)/social2orion/rest/sendSocialData

The is a POST method which needs the following parameters to be submitted: 

socialEventTypology= _(social event name)_
socialEventDateTime= _(social event date and time: dd-mm-yyyy-hh:MM:ss)_
socialEventImportancy= _(level of severity with respect to how the event is going to affect consumption/production in a specific area)_
socialEventVenueName= _(name of the venue where the social event is going to take place)_
socialEventVenueAddress= _(address of the venue)_  
socialEventLocationCoordLong= _(longitude coordinate of the venue)_
socialEventLocationCoordLat= _(latitude coordinate of the venue)_

Overview:
What you get

Social2Orion is a REST service (developed in Java) which allows clients (e.g. Social Events Information Providers) to register data about social events (affecting consumption/production in a specific area such as a concert or a football match) into an instance of ORION Context Broker GE.

This component can be eventually re-used and customized to fulfill the general need of having a REST service which is connected to the ORION GE.

Why to get it

A reference implementation of a REST service which is connected to the ORION GE.

Target Usage

  • Social Events Information Providers (which may be appointed by energy companies that would need information on social events affecting consumption/production in a specific area)
  • Third-party applications (such as those developed by SMEs involved in Phase3)
